title: Chinese military deploys military medical team to Ethiopia (3rd)
description: On January 10, 2017, a Chinese military medical expert team was sent to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to complete a medical assistance mission. The nine members of the medical team are all clinical doctors from the departments of nephrology, cardiovascular internal medicine, urinary surgery, ear-nose-throat, oral and maxillofacial surgery, operation anesthesia and radiology of the Southwest Hospital affiliated to the Third Military Medical University. The team will carry out clinical treatment, personnel training and technical assistance at the General Hospital of the Ethiopian National Defense Forces (ENDF) in Addis Ababa.   The current status of the project and the team is unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese military deploys military medical team to Ethiopia (3rd)

# Description
On January 10, 2017, a Chinese military medical expert team was sent to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to complete a medical assistance mission. The nine members of the medical team are all clinical doctors from the departments of nephrology, cardiovascular internal medicine, urinary surgery, ear-nose-throat, oral and maxillofacial surgery, operation anesthesia and radiology of the Southwest Hospital affiliated to the Third Military Medical University. The team will carry out clinical treatment, personnel training and technical assistance at the General Hospital of the Ethiopian National Defense Forces (ENDF) in Addis Ababa.   The current status of the project and the team is unclear.
justification: Project is focused on medical assistance and training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment, clinical treatment, personnel training, technical assistance

title: China sends medical team to Ethiopia (20th)
description: In August 2017, the Chinese government sent their 20th medical team to Ethiopia. The 20th team was a continuation of medical cooperation between Ethiopia and China since 1974. Comprising 15 medical professionals and 1 translator, the 20th team was headed by cardiologist Zhao Cheng. The team was based at the Tirunesh-Beijing Ethio-China Friendship Hospital on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. Along with work at the Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital, the team has done medical treatments in more than 73 clinics and two Chinese companies.  In November 2017, 10 medical team members provided services including mouth and respiratory organ treatments, eyes protection support and heart condition checkups to school children in Addis Ababa.
staff_comments: The exact start and end dates for the 20th medical team are unclear, though the project has been marked as completed because the 21st medical team has begun work in Ethiopia.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description
In August 2017, the Chinese government sent their 20th medical team to Ethiopia. The 20th team was a continuation of medical cooperation between Ethiopia and China since 1974. The team was based at the Tirunesh-Beijing Ethio-China Friendship Hospital on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. Along with work at the Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital, the team has done medical treatments in more than 73 clinics and two Chinese companies. justification: Project is focused on healthcare services and medical cooperation, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, focus on medical treatments and cooperation

title: Chinese Embassy provides donation to Bebebe Zehe Orphanage in Ethiopia
description: On March 9, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia and the Women's and Children's Youth Affairs Bureau of the Municipal Government of Addis Ababa in Ethiopia and the Women's Affairs Department of the Foreign Ministry of Ethiopia held a joint ceremony at the Bebebe Zehe Orphanage. The ceremony was in celebration of a Chinese Embassy donation of schoolbags, washing machines, football, food and other school supplies to the orphanage.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides donation to Bebebe Zehe Orphanage in Ethiopia

# Description
On March 9, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia and the Women's and Children's Youth Affairs Bureau of the Municipal Government of Addis Ababa in Ethiopia and the Women's Affairs Department of the Foreign Ministry of Ethiopia held a joint ceremony at the Bebebe Zehe Orphanage. The ceremony was in celebration of a Chinese Embassy donation of schoolbags, washing machines, football, food and other school supplies to the orphanage.
justification: Project is a social welfare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of school supplies and basic amenities to orphanage, no energy-related components

title: Chinese government finances demonstration base for paddy rice cultivation at Werer Agricultural Research Center
description: In February 2017, a base for rice experiments and demonstration was established in the Werer Agricultural Research Center in Northeast Ethiopia's Afar region, which is affiliated with Ethiopia Institute of Agricultural Research and is 278 kilometers away from the capital, Addis Ababa. The project was funded by the Chinese government, but the amount of financing is unclear.  The construction of the base was led by Luo Xueyi, who along with another Chinese agricultural expert, arrived in Ethiopia in May 2016 to find irrigation solutions in water shortage areas. Working with local agricultural experts, they wrote a proposal to the Ministry of Agriculture of Ethiopia, suggesting the establishment of a demonstration project on productive paddy rice cultivation in Werer. One month later, the proposal was authorized and Werer was designated as an experimental demonstration base for paddy rice cultivation.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese government finances demonstration base for paddy rice cultivation at Werer Agricultural Research Center

# Description
In February 2017, a base for rice experiments and demonstration was established in the Werer Agricultural Research Center in Northeast Ethiopia's Afar region, which is affiliated with Ethiopia Institute of Agricultural Research and is 278 kilometers away from the capital, Addis Ababa. The project was funded by the Chinese government, but the amount of financing is unclear.  The construction of the base was led by Luo Xueyi, who along with another Chinese agricultural expert, arrived in Ethiopia in May 2016 to find irrigation solutions in water shortage areas. Working with local agricultural experts, they wrote a proposal to the Ministry of Agriculture of Ethiopia, suggesting the establishment of a demonstration project on productive paddy rice cultivation in Werer. One month later, the proposal was authorized and Werer was designated as an experimental demonstration base for paddy rice cultivation.
justification: Agricultural research and demonstration project focused on improving rice cultivation techniques, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Demonstration base for paddy rice cultivation, agricultural research focus, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese government funds bamboo craftsmanship training in Ethiopia
description: In July 2017, 38 trainees graduated from a bamboo craftsmanship program facilitated by the Chinese government and Ministry of Industry under Small & Medium Manufacturing Agency. The Chinese Embassy has pledged to turn the plan to build a National Bamboo Training center into fruition. It is unclear how much financing was used to fund this particular training program.
combined_text:

GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

The Chinese Embassy has pledged to turn the plan to build a National Bamboo Training center into fruition. It is unclear how much financing was used to fund this particular training program.
justification: Project focuses on skills training and capacity building without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Bamboo craftsmanship training program, capacity building initiative

title: Chinese governments grants 1,100 trainings and 207 scholarships to Ethiopians
description: In August 2017, the Ethiopian News Agency reported that 1,100 Ethiopians were being offered short-term training programs in China and 359 Ethiopian students were offered to pursue higher education in China. Of the 359 students offered to study in China, 207 were offered scholarships for postgraduate study. Among the 359 scholarship recipients five are state ministers and the remaining are from federal and state offices, educational institutions and various industries.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Description

Of the 359 students offered to study in China, 207 were offered scholarships for postgraduate study. Among the 359 scholarship recipients five are state ministers and the remaining are from federal and state offices, educational institutions and various industries.
justification: Project focuses on education and training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training programs and scholarships for Ethiopian students, no energy-related components mentioned

title: ZTE launches health system project at African Union headquarters
description: In October 2017, the African Union (AU) and ZTE launched a smart health system project at the AU headquarters in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa. The AU Medical and Health Services Directorate (MHSD) aims to make healthcare more proactive, integrated, personalized, and empowered through the launching of a Smart Health Monitoring project. ZTE has established a demo smart health monitoring room to show how the Africa Center for Disease Control (CDC) will operate. It is unclear how much the project cost, and no timeline was given for the project's completion.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

It is unclear how much the project cost, and no timeline was given for the project's completion.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare system development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Smart health monitoring system, healthcare services improvement focus

title: Chinese Embassy and Confucius Institute launch Chinese language program for Ethiopian airport employees
description: In May 2017, Addis Ababa Bole International Airport said it had seen 70 Ethiopian customer service professionals graduate recently from a Chinese language training program aimed at providing better service to Chinese passengers. The Chinese Embassy in Addis Ababa organized the program in partnership with the Confucius Institute. The language training was performed over a 10-week period. According to China Daily, a second round of training was due to start soon after May 2017. It is unclear how much the training cost the Chinese embassy and/or the Confucius Institute.
combined_text:

EDUCATION

The Chinese Embassy in Addis Ababa organized the program in partnership with the Confucius Institute. The language training was performed over a 10-week period. According to China Daily, a second round of training was due to start soon after May 2017. It is unclear how much the training cost the Chinese embassy and/or the Confucius Institute.
justification: Language training program focused on cultural exchange and service improvement, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Chinese language training for airport employees, organized by Chinese Embassy and Confucius Institute

title: China Eximbank provides $89.8 million loan for Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project
description: On December 25, 2017, China Eximbank and Ethiopian Electric Power Corporation (EEPCo) — an Ethiopian state-owned power company — signed an $89,817,892.24 loan agreement for the Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project. The Ethiopian Government issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance approximately 85% of the cost of a $99.4396 million (ETB 2 billion) commercial (EPC) contract between EEPCo and Shanghai Electric Group Company, which was signed on May 9, 2016.   The project involves electricity substation construction and expansion in three towns: Bahir Dar, Woldiya and Combolcha (Kombolcha). More specifically, it involves the construction of a new 400/230/33/15kV Woldiya II substation, the construction of a new 400/230/33kV Combolcha III substation, and the expansion of the existing 400kV Bahir Dar II substation (by 1 line bay), and the expansion of the existing 230kV Combolcha II substation (by 1 line interval). Upon completion, the project is expected to meet the power demands of industrial parks, an electrified train, and condominiums near the towns of Bahir Dar, Woldiya and Combolcha (Kombolcha).   Shanghai Electric Group Company is the general EPC contractor responsible for project implementation. However, it hired Powerchina Jiangxi Electric Power Construction Co., Ltd. as a subcontractor on August 30, 2017. Project implementation was originally scheduled to commence in October 2017 and reach completion within 18 months (May 2019). Construction of the 400/230/33/15kV Woldiya II substation had achieved a 48% completion rate as of June 2, 2021.   There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. According to the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform, as of September 2019, ICBC suspended about $67 million worth of loan disbursements 'due to [the] cross-default situation of the country’ (see Project ID#58616). Then, in August 2021, China Eximbank withheld $339 million loan disbursements for 12 projects and halted project implementation due to Government of Ethiopia’s rapidly dwindling foreign exchange reserves and debt sustainability challenges. Demisu Lemma, the Director of Chinese Cooperation at the Ethiopian Ministry of Finance, noted at the time that the Ethiopian Government was in discussions with China Eximbank about a potential debt rescheduling (that would involved a 5-year maturity extension and a 1-year grace period extension). Then, after considerable delay, the G20 Common Framework (CF) creditor committee for Ethiopia convened in September 2021, with the French Government and the Chinese Government serving as co-chairs. The CF debt rescheduling talks were still ongoing in mid-2023.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Bahir Dar-II, Woldiya-II/400/230/33/15KV and Combolcha-III 400/230/33 KV Substations Project, the Bahirdarii-Woldiaii-Kombolcha Substation Project, and the BDWC 1 - LOT3A substation project. 2. The Chinese project title is BDWC-1-LOT3A变电站 or 埃塞俄比亚BDWC-1/LOT3A变电站总承包项目. 3. Azeb Asnake, EEPCo’s CEO, signed the May 9, 2016 commercial contract with Shanghai Electric Group Company’s representative, Xiang Rui.4. The system identification number for the project in the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform (AMP) is 87143436115460. The AMP identifies the face value of the loan as ETB 2,456,509,914. It does not record any loan disbursements as of April 2022.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides $89.8 million loan for Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project

# Description
On December 25, 2017, China Eximbank and Ethiopian Electric Power Corporation (EEPCo) — an Ethiopian state-owned power company — signed an $89,817,892.24 loan agreement for the Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project. The Ethiopian Government issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance approximately 85% of the cost of a $99.4396 million (ETB 2 billion) commercial (EPC) contract between EEPCo and Shanghai Electric Group Company, which was signed on May 9, 2016.   The project involves electricity substation construction and expansion in three towns: Bahir Dar, Woldiya and Combolcha (Kombolcha). More specifically, it involves the construction of a new 400/230/33/15kV Woldiya II substation, the construction of a new 400/230/33kV Combolcha III substation, and the expansion of the existing 400kV Bahir Dar II substation (by 1 line bay), and the expansion of the existing 230kV Combolcha II substation (by 1 line interval). Upon completion, the project is expected to meet the power demands of industrial parks, an electrified train, and condominiums near the towns of Bahir Dar, Woldiya and Combolcha (Kombolcha).   Shanghai Electric Group Company is the general EPC contractor responsible for project implementation. However, it hired Powerchina Jiangxi Electric Power Construction Co., Ltd. as a subcontractor on August 30, 2017. Project implementation was originally scheduled to commence in October 2017 and reach completion within 18 months (May 2019). Construction of the 400/230/33/15kV Woldiya II substation had achieved a 48% completion rate as of June 2, 2021.   There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Bahir Dar-Woldiya-Combolcha Substation Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. According to the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform, as of September 2019, ICBC suspended about $67 million worth of loan disbursements 'due to [the] cross-default situation of the country’ (see Project ID#58616). Then, in August 2021, China Eximbank withheld $339 million loan disbursements for 12 projects and halted project implementation due to Government of Ethiopia’s rapidly dwindling foreign exchange reserves and debt sustainability challenges. Demisu Lemma, the Director of Chinese Cooperation at the Ethiopian Ministry of Finance, noted at the time that the Ethiopian Government was in discussions with China Eximbank about a potential debt rescheduling (that would involved a 5-year maturity extension and a 1-year grace period extension). Then, after considerable delay, the G20 Common Framework (CF) creditor committee for Ethiopia convened in September 2021, with the French Government and the Chinese Government serving as co-chairs. The CF debt rescheduling talks were still ongoing in mid-2023.
justification: Project focuses on electricity substation construction and expansion, which is essential grid infrastructure with indirect relationship to energy transition
evidence: Construction of new 400/230/33/15kV Woldiya II substation, new 400/230/33kV Combolcha III substation, and expansion of existing substations to meet power demands

title: Jiangsu Bank of China signs $18.28 million export buyer credit agreement to Ethiopian Electric Power Company for import of seven mobile substations
description: On May 16, 2017, Bank of China Jiangsu Branch and Ethiopian Electric Power Company signed  the "Ethiopia Mobile Substation Project Export Buyer Credit Agreement". This agreement states that the Bank of China will provide $18.28 million export buyer's credit for the import of 7 mobile substations from Nari Group.
staff_comments: This loan is omitted from the database of Chinese loan commitments that SAIS-CARI released in July 2020.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
Jiangsu Bank of China signs $18.28 million export buyer credit agreement to Ethiopian Electric Power Company for import of seven mobile substations

# Description
On May 16, 2017, Bank of China Jiangsu Branch and Ethiopian Electric Power Company signed  the "Ethiopia Mobile Substation Project Export Buyer Credit Agreement". This agreement states that the Bank of China will provide $18.28 million export buyer's credit for the import of 7 mobile substations from Nari Group.
justification: Mobile substations are critical grid infrastructure components that support electricity transmission and distribution, but do not directly contribute to energy transition goals
evidence: Project involves import of 7 mobile substations for electricity grid infrastructure
